intro: Thesium schweinfurthii var. laxum, commonly known as the loose-flowered thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the genus Thesium. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
